title: Big, quiet room, bilingual roommate
body:
QR Code Link to This Post


Looking for a quiet and calm place to live in Paris? Willing to share a gem of an apartment with a young, bilingual, hotel professional who can give you great advice to navigate the city? How about a big room (38 square feet) in the 18th district of Paris? Our place is in a beautiful Haussmann building, in one of the up-and-coming area of the Capital. It is two minutes to the metro station Jules Joffrin on line 12, or line 4, and if you walk for an extra two minutes, and multiple bus stops (80, 31, 60).

On the first floor (European), with elevator, this apartment is situated between two interior courtyards so no street noises, and the star layout allows for practicality and privacy.

The high ceilings, intricate mouldings, marble fireplaces, and oak floors remind you of la belle époche of this amazing city. There are two bedrooms, a living room with a dinning area table and a small couch, a fully equipped kitchen, a stand-up closet, separate toilets, and at the end of the hall, between the two bedrooms is the bathroom with a bathtub and devine water pressure.

Lots of cafés, restaurants, local shops, and an open market in ana area which is not at all touristic. Internet is fast and the bed is super-comfortable.
